Name: Situla
Description: This situla of bronze comes from the hypostyle hall of the T temple at Kawa, a town to the south of the 3rd cataract. Used as a libation vase, it takes the form of a breast of which the base is decorated with a lotus flower, symbol of rebirth. On the belly is drawn a scene representing an offering to the god Amun-Min. The piece probably dates from the reign of  King Taharqa.
